CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Three kinds of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type semiconducting copolymers in which electron donating units of dithienopyrrole ( DTP ) and accepting units of benzothiadiazole ( BT ) were connected with different numbers of thienyl spacers ( x = 0-2 ) were synthesized and used as electron donor materials in polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) combined with fullerene derivatives.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| dithienopyrrole (DTP) |
| benzothiadiazole (BT) |
| semiconducting copolymers with electron donating units of dithienopyrrole and accepting units of benzothiadiazole |
| fullerene derivatives |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| dithienopyrrole (DTP) |
| benzothiadiazole (BT) |
| semiconducting copolymers with electron donating units of dithienopyrrole and accepting units of benzothiadiazole |
| fullerene derivatives |

These are the entities in the paragraph that can be identified as material names, as they refer to specific chemical compounds or materials used in the context of the paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Three kinds of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) type semiconducting copolymers in which electron donating units of dithienopyrrole ( DTP ) and accepting units of benzothiadiazole ( BT ) were connected with different numbers of thienyl spacers ( x = 0-2 ) were synthesized and used as electron donor materials in polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) combined with fullerene derivatives.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value            |
|--------------------------|
| Three kinds of donor-acceptor (D-A) type semiconducting copolymers |
| Electron donating units of dithienopyrrole (DTP) |
| Accepting units of benzothiadiazole (BT) |
| Different numbers of thienyl spacers (x = 0-2) |
| Electron donor materials in polymer solar cells (PSCs) |
| Fullerene derivatives |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value            |
|--------------------------|
| Three kinds of D-A type semiconducting copolymers |
| Electron donating units of dithienopyrrole (DTP) |
| Accepting units of benzothiadiazole (BT) |
| Different numbers of thienyl spacers (x = 0-2) |
| Fullerene derivatives |
| Electron donor materials in polymer solar cells (PSCs) |

Explanation:

* Three kinds of D-A type semiconducting copolymers: This refers to the type of material being synthesized and used in the solar cells.
* Electron donating units of dithienopyrrole (DTP): This refers to a specific chemical unit within the copolymers that donates electrons.
* Accepting units of benzothiadiazole (BT): This refers to a specific chemical unit within the copolymers that accepts electrons.
* Different numbers of thienyl spacers (x = 0-2): This refers to the number of spacers between the DTP and BT units in the copolymers.
* Fullerene derivatives: This refers to a specific type of material used in combination with the copolymers in the solar cells.
* Electron donor materials in polymer solar cells (PSCs): This refers to the overall role of the copolymers in the solar cells as materials that donate electrons.
